criterion: Provides incorrect information about the duration of a fever in children.
Does not provide any guidance on seeking medical attention.
Correctly advises against self-diagnosis and encourages seeking professional medical advice.
Uses natural language and provides clear, concise information.
Does not provide any information about local viruses or disease transmission.
Correctly advises on home care and monitoring for a child's fever.
Does not provide any information about medication or treatment options.
Correctly advises on when to seek medical attention for a child's fever.
